abstract: The Pentagons growing use of civilian manpower to augment force projection  including the deployment of civilian mariners aboard U.S. warships during contingency operations against Libya in 2011  raises serious questions at the intersection of law and war.
title: Blurring the Civilian-Combatant Line: Legal Implications of Deploying U.S. Civilian Mariners in the Libyan Theater
subject: law
